title: Conduct a survey
content:
A survey begins running when it moves to Execute phase, and ends when it leaves Execute phase. There are two ways to begin or end a survey:

  • Manually – by moving the survey phase in the workflow.
  • Automatically – by setting the Active from and Active until attributes in the survey.

Collected answers are synced to the analytics database once per day. Reports are calculated according to their defined calculation time (the calculated every property in the report). This means that answers aren't reflected immediately in the reports.

Send a survey manually

Note If the survey isn't yet in Execute phase, it can still be sent for review, but no data will be collected, or displayed in reports.

  1. From the main menu, select Build > Survey. Service Management displays the available surveys.
  2. Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.
  3. Click Send survey now.
  4. Enter the recipients to whom you want to send the survey.
  5. If the survey is defined on a record type, select a record (of that type) on which to send the survey.
  6. Select the notification template for the report. You can use Survey default template, or create one of your own. For more information about survey notification templates, see Survey notification templates.
  7. Click Send.

Create a business rule to send a survey

Notes
To add business rules to a survey, you must have Admin permission on the Survey record type.
To send a survey by triggering a business rule, the survey must be in the Execute phase.

You can create a business rule for sending a survey only on one of the following process events:

  • Entering
  • Leaving
  • After applying changes
  • After adding relationship
  • After removing relationship
  • Before deleting

In addition, you can create such a business rule on any transition (between phases).​​​​​ 

To create a business rule to send a survey:

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Studio.

  2. From the drop-down list at the top of the page, select the record type. 

  3. In the Rules tab, under the relevant section, create a rule:

    1. Click Add  , and select the type of rule to add.
    2. In the Set rule dialog box, select Actions > Survey notification and click OK.
      A simple business rule will look similar to this, before values are specified:

    3. Enter the following parameters:

      Parameter Value
      Survey name Select the survey that you want to send.
      recipients and groups The person or group to whom the survey will be sent.
      once every number of times the rule runs Specify how often you want the survey to be sent. Enter 1 to send the survey each time the rule runs. Enter a larger number if you don't want to send the survey each time the rule runs.
      notification template Specify the notification template to be used for sending the survey. Select Survey default template or a custom survey notification template if available. For more information about survey notification templates, see Survey notification templates.
      parameters If custom parameters were specified in the notification template, specify them here.
    4. Save the rule.

Example: If there is a survey called User satisfaction survey, you can define a rule in Service Request Management to send a notification to the Requested for user when a request is closed. You can configure the rule to send a survey once every 5 times it runs to reduce the number of mails sent to users. The rule sends the user a notification every 5 times the rule runs, using the Survey default template (with no parameters) with a link to the User satisfaction survey.
